pronunciation: PER'SECUTE, [Latin persequor; per and sequor, to pursue. See Seek and Essay.]

definitions.text:
1. In general sense, manner injure, vex afflict; harass with unjust punishment penalties for supposed offenses; inflict pain from hatred malignity.
2. Appropriately, afflict, harass, destroy for adherence particular creed system of religious principles, mode of worship. Thus Nero persecuted the Christians by crucifying some, burning others, condemning others be worried by dogs. Acts 22:4.
3. To harass with solicitations importunity.
